import java.util.Scanner;

class NprimeDividors {
	static int prime[];

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		prime = new int[100030];
		Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
		int t = sc.nextInt();
		check(2, 100010);
		for (int i = 0; i < t; i++) {
			int x = sc.nextInt();
			int y = sc.nextInt();
			int n = sc.nextInt();
			int c = 0;
			for (int j = x; j <= y; j++) {
				if (prime[j] == n)
					c++;

			}
			System.out.println(c);

		}

	}

	private static void check(int x, int y) {

		for (int i = x; i <= y; i++) {
			int t = i;
			int c = 0;
			for (int j = 2; j <= Math.sqrt(t); j++) {
				boolean f = false;

				while (t % j == 0) {
					f = true;
					t /= j;

				}
				if (f) {
					c++;
					f = false;

				}

			}
			if (t > 1) {
				c++;
			}
			prime[i] = c;

		}

	}

}
